p: The obesogenic state can also affect the influenza A virus evolution. It is well known that obese individuals are malnourished besides their excess in fat; they might also present nutrient deficiencies, such as vitamins [ 7], minerals, and trace elements [ 8]. There are a variety of mechanisms by which nutritional imbalances could alter within-host viral evolution [ 8]. Studies have shown that such imbalances prolong infections, delay clearance, and increase shedding (42% longer than non-obese) [ 9], all of which potentially increase viral transmission [ 1].
